activate_name.name: Activate item by name
activate_name.note: If there are multiple choices with the same text, they the first one on the screen will be clicked. To disambiguate, use the "click <role>" command.

activate_role.name: Click Type
activate_role.note: where role is "link", "button", "text field", "image", "Check box", "Radio Button", etc. If there are multiple instances of the role, Dragon will then flag each matching element with a number. Say "choose <number>" to finish.

move_down.name: Move down <n> options
move_down.note: must be in a listbox context

move_up.name: Move up <n> options
move_up.note: must be in a listbox context

multiple_commands.name: Multiple commands were used
multiple_commands.notes: Used when testing a composite widget provided by a browser or OS such as a color picker. Do not use if a more specific command fits better.

enter_interaction_mode.name: Enter forms mode
enter_interaction_mode.note: Automatically activated when entering a form control.

exit_interaction_mode.name: exit forms mode (go to PC cursor)

enter_text.name: enter text
enter_text.note: must be in a form or application context, and this is native browser behavior.

next_option.name: select next option
next_option.note: must be in a listbox context, and this is native browser behavior.

previous_option.name: select previous option
previous_option.note: must be in a listbox context, and this is native browser behavior.

select_option.name: select an option
select_option.note: must be in a listbox context, and this is native browser behavior.

follow_flowto.name: Follow the element referenced by aria-flowto

follow_flowfrom.name: Go to the the first element that references this element via aria-flowto

move_to_start_of_container.name: Move to the start of the container
move_to_start_of_container.note: Will move to the start of the current container (list, table, etc)

move_to_end_of_container.name: Past the end of the container
move_to_end_of_container.note: Will move past the end of the current container (list, table, etc)

forms_mode_keyboard_command.name: Keyboard command while in forms or application mode

multiple_commands.name: Multiple commands were used
multiple_commands.notes: Used when testing a composite widget provided by a browser or OS such as a color picker. Do not use if a more specific command fits better.

read_item_advanced.name: Read item (advanced)
read_item_advanced.note: Announces advanced information about the current item

next_navigation_type.name: Cycle view backward
next_navigation_type.note: Cycles the type of item to be read when using the Read next item and Read previous item commands.

previous_navigation_type.name: Cycle view forward
previous_navigation_type.note: Cycles the type of item to be read when using the Read next item and Read previous item commands.

next_item_of_type.name: Read next item (item view, scan mode off)

previous_item_of_type.name: Read previous item (item view, scan mode off)

enter_text.name: enter text
enter_text.note: must be in a form or application context, and this is native browser behavior.

next_option.name: select next option
next_option.note: must be in a listbox context, and this is native browser behavior.

previous_option.name: select previous option
previous_option.note: must be in a listbox context, and this is native browser behavior.

select_option.name: select an option
select_option.note: must be in a listbox context, and this is native browser behavior.

toggle_reading_mode.name: Toggle Scan Mode on and off
toggle_reading_mode.note: Enabled automatically when you use Microsoft Edge.

start_reading_from_current_position.command: swipe up then right, select 'read from next item'
start_reading_from_current_position.name: Read from current position

global_context_menu.name: Global context menu
global_context_menu.note: This feature was removed in Talkback 9.1

local_context_menu.name: Turn Off
local_context_menu.note: This feature was removed in Talkback 9.1

next_reading_control.name: Next reading control
next_reading_control.note: This command changes the type of control is found with the swipe up or swipe down gestures. You can customize the controls found in this menu by going to customize menus > customize reading controls.

previous_reading_control.name: Next reading control
previous_reading_control.note: This command changes the type of control is found with the swipe up or swipe down gestures. You can customize the controls found in this menu by going to customize menus > customize reading controls.

next_landmark.command: swipe down after changing the reading control to 'landmarks' (alt+D)
next_landmark.name: Next landmark
next_landmark.note: this reading control is not in the reading controls menu by default. You can enable it by going to customize menus > customize reading controls.

turn_on.command: Power button, then hold two fingers
turn_on.name: Turn On

enter_text.name: enter text
enter_text.note: must be in a form or application context, and this is native browser behavior.

next_heading.name: next heading (correct reading control must be selected)

previous_heading.name: previous heading (correct reading control must be selected)

next_link.name: next link (correct reading control must be selected)

previous_link.name: previous link (correct reading control must be selected)

next_form_field.name: next control (correct reading control must be selected)

previous_form_field.name: previous control (correct reading control must be selected)

increment.name: increment value (must be on a role that supports the command)

decrement.name: decrement value (must be on a role that supports the command)

additional_information.name: Read additional information about the current position

dismiss_return.command: Two-finger scrub (move two fingers back and forth three times quickly, making a “z”)
dismiss_return.name: Dismisses an alert or returns to the previous screen.

previous_item_of_type.name: Previous item (as set by the rotor)

next_item_of_type.name: Next item (as set by the rotor)

read_all.name: Read all from the top of the screen

turn_off.name: Turn Off

turn_on.command: Triple press home (if setting is enabled)
turn_on.name: Turn On

touch_type.command: Explore the keyboard by single press + move (explore), then release on a key
